com.epoch.physics

Class EquationFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.physics.EquationFunctions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanonicalizedUnitConstants, EquationFunctionsConstants

    public final class EquationFunctions
extends Object
implements CanonicalizedUnitConstants, EquationFunctionsConstants
    Functions that use Maxima to evaluate mathematical equations and expressions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.epoch.physics.physicsConstants.CanonicalizedUnitConstants

      • isValidExpression

        public static void isValidExpression(String exprn)
                              throws ProcessExecutionException,
                                     EquationFormatException
        Determines whether an expression (or equation) is valid.
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        Throws:
        ProcessExecutionException - if the command can't be executed properly
        EquationFormatException - if the equation's format is bad

      • isValidExpression

        public static void isValidExpression(String exprn,
                                     boolean saveEqnInException)
                              throws ProcessExecutionException,
                                     EquationFormatException
        Determines whether an expression (or equation) is valid.
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        saveEqnInException - when true and the equation is malformed, make a new error message and throw out the one from Maxima
        Throws:
        ProcessExecutionException - if the command can't be executed properly
        EquationFormatException - if the equation's format is bad

                       throws ProcessExecutionException,
                              EquationFormatException
        Extracts the Maxima solution(s) from the output string.
        Parameters:
        calcn - the maxima calculation to run
        Returns:
        one or more results of the maxima calculation
        Throws:
        ProcessExecutionException - if the command can't be executed properly
        EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

      • execute

        public static String execute(String calcn)
                      throws ProcessExecutionException,
                             EquationFormatException
        Uses Maxima to reduce an expression or to solve an equation. May give more than one solution.
        Parameters:
        calcn - the maxima calculation to run
        Returns:
        one or more results of the maxima calculation
        Throws:
        ProcessExecutionException - if the command can't be executed properly
        EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

                             boolean saveEqnInException)
                      throws ProcessExecutionException,
                             EquationFormatException
        Uses Maxima to reduce an expression or to solve an equation. May give more than one solution.
        Parameters:
        calcn - the maxima calculation to run
        saveEqnInException - when true and the equation is malformed, make a new error message and throw out the one from Maxima
        Returns:
        one or more results of the maxima calculation
        Throws:
        ProcessExecutionException - if the command can't be executed properly
        EquationFormatException - if the result is not a reduced equation or expression

      • formatExpression

        public static String formatExpression(String exprn)
        Formats the expression for Maxima, with implicit multiplication made explicit, µ and μ converted to u, and units canonicalized, and log(x) changed to log(1.0*x).
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        Returns:
        the expression formatted for Maxima

      • formatExpression

        public static String formatExpression(String exprn,
                                      int canonicaliznExtent)
        Formats the expression for Maxima, with implicit multiplication made explicit, µ and μ converted to u, and units canonicalized, and log(x) changed to log(1.0*x).
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        canonicaliznExtent - to what extent to convert units to their canonicalized form: FULL_CANONICALZN, OMIT_FACTORS, or NO_CANONICALZN
        Returns:
        the expression formatted for Maxima

      • formatExpression

        public static String formatExpression(String exprn,
                                      String[] variablesNotUnits)
        Formats the expression for Maxima, with implicit multiplication made explicit, µ and μ converted to u, and units canonicalized, and log(x) changed to log(1.0*x).
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        variablesNotUnits - names of variables that should not be treated as units
        Returns:
        the expression formatted for Maxima

      • formatExpression

        public static String formatExpression(String exprn,
                                      String[] variablesNotUnits,
                                      int canonicaliznExtent)
        Formats the expression for Maxima, with implicit multiplication made explicit, µ and μ converted to u, and units canonicalized.
        Parameters:
        exprn - the expression
        variablesNotUnits - names of variables that should not be treated as units
        canonicaliznExtent - to what extent to convert units to their canonicalized form: FULL_CANONICALZN, OMIT_FACTORS, or NO_CANONICALZN
        Returns:
        the expression formatted for Maxima

      • explicitizeMultiplication

        public static String explicitizeMultiplication(String entry)
        Explicitizes multiplication in the expression, and converts µ and μ to u.

        If consecutive digits are preceded by beginning of line, open parenthesis, white space, comma, or semicolon and followed by zero or more space characters and then a letter or open parenthesis or beginning of a numerical character entity reference, then put an asterisk between the digits and the letter or open parenthesis or character entity reference.

        Parameters:
        entry - the expression
        Returns:
        the entry formatted for Maxima

      • makeLogInputRational

        public static String makeLogInputRational(String entry)
        Changes log(x) to log(1.0*x) because Maxima won't evaluate the logarithms of integers.
        Parameters:
        entry - the expression
        Returns:
        the entry formatted for Maxima

      • canonicalizeUnits

        public static String canonicalizeUnits(String eqn,
                                       String[] variables)
        Replaces each variable that is recognized as a unit with the equivalent SI unit.
        Parameters:
        eqn - the equation or expression
        variables - variables in the equation or expression that may be units
        Returns:
        the equation or expression, with each unit replaced with the equivalent SI unit

      • canonicalizeUnits

        public static String canonicalizeUnits(String eqn,
                                       String[] variables,
                                       int canonicaliznExtent)
        Replaces each variable that is recognized as a unit with the equivalent SI unit.
        Parameters:
        eqn - the equation or expression
        variables - variables in the equation or expression that may be units
        canonicaliznExtent - to what extent to convert units to their canonicalized form
        Returns:
        the equation or expression, with each unit replaced with the equivalent SI unit

      • separateMagnitudePrefix

        private static String[] separateMagnitudePrefix(String unit)
        Separates the magnitude prefix of a unit into the base unit and the power of ten.
        Parameters:
        unit - a unit that may have a magnitude prefix
        Returns:
        the base unit and, if it had a magnitude prefix, the prefix's power of ten

        Extracts the variables from an equation or expression.

        origEqn - the equation or expression
        Returns:
        array of names of variables

                                    String constants)
        Extracts the variables from an equation or expression.
        Parameters:
        origEqn - the equation or expression
        constants - constants associated with the equation or expression, already formatted for submission to Maxima
        Returns:
        array of names of variables

        public static boolean isEquation(String exprnOrEqn)
        Determines whether an expression or equation is an equation.
        Parameters:
        exprnOrEqn - an expression or equation
        Returns:
        true if the expression or equation contains an equal sign

      • isMultivariable

        public static boolean isMultivariable(String solvedEqn)
        Gets whether Maxima failed to solve an equation because there were more variables than equations.
        Parameters:
        solvedEqn - result from Maxima
        Returns:
        true if there were more variables than equations
